title: Piano Lessons for Beginners
headline: Explore basic music theory and learn piano skills to play simple songs fluently in this free online course.
description: Learn to confidently play songs on the piano in this complete beginner course. Explore the basics of playing the piano, beginning with the keyboard structure - the white keys and accidentals. The lessons will discuss tones, scales, intervals and chords while you practise them on the piano. You will practise all your new skills using two popular songs to be ready to progress to the intermediate lessons by the end of the course. Enrol today!
courseDescription:
This free piano course is for newbies. It is designed to provide a solid foundation for learners to improve their skills progressively. Sly Mills Jnr, the instructor, grew up with a passion for music and has been a music director and piano instructor for the past fifteen years. He has taught people of all ages to play the piano. He is also the founder of ‘Miuzikempire.com’, a resource site for aspiring musicians and enthusiasts. Sly teaches beginners with clarity, simplicity and technical competence. You can expect to begin playing easy tunes by the end of the course.

We will start with the keyboard structure, exploring the names of the white keys and accidentals. Here you will understand how the twelve music notes were derived. We will then discuss scales and how they are constructed from tones and semitones. Explore the major scale and learn about ‘intervals’ - the distance between notes. The following section discusses the major chords on a piano. A chord is a combination of three or more notes played simultaneously but we will focus on playing mainly three for this course. We will analyse chord inversion and examine how to form minor chords.

The course will then teach you about suspended chords. There are two types - suspended two and suspended four. We will examine diminished chords constructed by playing the root note, the flattened third and then the flattened fifth. Finally, we combine everything you have learned and practised in two popular songs: ‘The Storm is Over Now’ by R. Kelly and ‘You Raise me Up’ by Westlife. If you are anxious about playing and feel inexperienced, this course is perfect. It will prove that anyone can learn to play the piano from scratch. With consistent practice and some discipline on your part, you too can attain skills. Sign up today.
